images.copyright: A pumpkin patch in Newton, Massachusetts (© Frank Debonis/EyeEm/Alamy)
images.title: In a field of fruits…or vegetables?
images.caption: Pumpkin patch
images.desc: It's not too late to pick up a pumpkin to add some Halloween flair to your doorstep. Although pumpkins are grown across the country, most of the 2 billion pounds produced annually in the US come from five states: California, Illinois, Indiana, Pennsylvania, and Texas. While California grows the most pumpkins headed for the jack-o'-lantern market, Illinois wins in poundage, though most of its crop ends up as pie filling or other processed products—perhaps even in your pumpkin spice latte?
images.bsTitle: In a field of fruits…or vegetables?
